results.title: Junior Business Analyst
results.description:
We are looking for a Junior Business Analyst who will be the vital link between our information technology capacity and our business objectives by supporting and ensuring the successful completion of analytical, building, testing and deployment tasks of our software product’s features.

 

Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. We believe that innovation is powered by perspective and that teamwork and respect for each other lead to superior results. We elevate each other and obsess about doing the right thing. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to revolutionize early years childcare and pre-schools communication and management solutions for good.

 

Job description

  • Analyzing business requirements to understand the business needs and to determine how systems and applications can best functionally fulfill those needs.

  • Collaborate with product development, marketing, and success teams to translate business into clear requirements.

  • Scheduling and leading requirements with stakeholders; gathering testable system requirements and translating them into and user stories.

  • Analyzing impact of the proposed solutions.

  • Develops business rules as well as supporting process flows.

  • Working closely with the Design team to provide the best user experience.

  • Writing clear and well-structured user stories, performs quality assurance, configuration assistance and application training.

  • Work closely with development teams to ensure that they understand and deliver the needed solution.

  • Gather users’ feedback for the implemented solution.

  • Have excellent communication, interpersonal, and analytical skills.

  • Bachelor¹s degree in Computer science, Information System or Engineering is preferred.

  • 1 to 2 years’ experience in business analysis & product ownership.

  • Experience in Agile methodology is a Must.

  • Certification in Agile methodology is preferred.

  • Experience in CRM’s and preferably within the education sector.

  • Very good at writing and speaking English.

  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills.

results.title: Business Analyst
results.description:
Zaizi are looking for a (SFIA4/5) Business Analyst with Central Government experience to help drive, lead and make a positive contribution to our customer’s digital transformation programmes.

 

At Zaizi, we thrive on solving complex challenges through creative thinking and the latest tools and tech. Our culture is inclusive, modern, friendly and innovative. We seek bright, positive thinking individuals with a can-do attitude. Our people enjoy challenging themselves to be the best at what they do – if that sounds like you, you'll fit right in!

You will have in-depth knowledge of the software development life cycle and be a strong team player, who can communicate well with customers at all stages of the project life cycle and set customer expectations.

 

Role Objectives:

These are the expected objectives for this role. We are happy to discuss this further during the interview process and jointly agree it with the successful candidate.

  • Understand and define the problem to be solved.
  • Understand users and their needs and translate into user stories.
  • Help the delivery team decide the best approach, manage and visualise outcomes, prioritise work and work to the agreed minimum viable product (MVP), print and scope.
  • Support test functionality and ensuring it meets user and business needs.
  • Supporting the Product Owner with the creation of a backlog.
  • Modelling business processes (As is / To be)



Requirements

Competencies:

You will have extensive commercial experience in the following:

  • Stakeholder management
  • Good understanding of Agile methodologies e.g (Scrum, Lean, Kanban)
  • Function & non-functional requirements
  • Acceptance criteria
  • User stories
  • Working with cross functional teams
  • Continuous improvement
  • Customer facing (build good rapport)
  • Understanding of Government transformation strategy & service standards


Desired

  • Data mapping
  • Experience working with API's.

Benefits


Security Clearance

Please note you will need to comply with Baseline Personnel Security Standard (BPSS) to be offered this role. In addition, you may be sponsored for Security Clearance (SC and/or DV). As such applicants MUST have the legal right to work in the UK, have lived in the UK continuously for the last ten years and have no criminal record.

 

Salary: £56,000 / £70,000

 

Benefits

25 days paid holiday, plus bank holidays
BUPA medical insurance
Workplace Pension
Group Life Assurance
Cyclescheme

Other benefits:
Flexible working
Work on exciting projects - make a difference
Empowered to make decisions
Encouraged to fail fast and learn quickly

results.title: ITAM Business Consultant (ServiceNow)
results.description:
We Lead. We Transform. We Deliver.

Ready to elevate your work experience? At Cask, you get to collaborate with incredibly talented people - designers, engineers, technologists, and industry thought leaders - who are all connected by a singular focus on solving business challenges that stand in the way of organizational change and progress. Along the way, we balance culture and business, resulting in a company that is committed to making the lives of our employees a little better and more fun each day through iteration and innovation.

Cask NX is seeking a ServiceNow Business Consultant to join our ITAM business functional team. In this role, you will participate in the design and development of ServiceNow ITAM solutions and strategies that drive digital transformation and innovation. This role requires a high-performing, results-oriented individual to guide our clients in adopting and adapting ITAM best practices in the most efficient and effective way to ensure maximum return on their investment. The ideal candidate is seen as a thought leader with a broad and deep understanding of IT asset management and asset-related business process concepts and able to drive the development of solutions to problems and critical IT asset management efforts, often for the most complex or difficult customer situations.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Build a customer-focused relationship with middle- to high-tier clients to identify business challenges and arrive at the best solution
  • Conduct needs analysis, establish project specifications, and identify solutions to customers’ business challenges
  • Compile business data using industry-specific knowledge to gain insight into a business organization and operating structure
  • Lead engagement as the Subject Matter Expert (SME) on relevant best practices
  • Lead business process definition, re-engineering, improvement, and gap analysis of current/to-be processes during workshops with key customer sponsors and stakeholders
  • Contribute to the development of customer value objectives and plans to realize the value
  • Become trusted advisor status with the customer throughout the engagement
  • Manage and communicate process and business requirements to the delivery team as a bridge to ensure that the proposed solutions meet the customer's expectations

What you’ll bring to the table:

  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience working in the areas of hardware and software asset management in a wide range of industries and/or performed as an IT Asset Management leader/practitioner
  • In-depth functional expertise and leadership for our clients on the ServiceNow ITAM suite of products including HAMP, SAMP, and CMDB.
  • Proven track record of leading at least 6+ implementations of ServiceNow SAMP with CSAT scores of 4.0 or higher
  • Expertise in Microsoft, Oracle, and Adobe license metrics and configuration within SAMP
  • Working with technical counterparts to advise our clients on their overall Asset Management-related tools and processes and help develop roadmaps, approaches, and plans to improve their overall maturity across their ITAM activities
  • Demonstrated experience communicating complex ideas with stakeholders and building collaborative relationships with team members, customers, and other stakeholders
  • Extensive experience in process management competencies
  • Demonstrated ability in providing thought leadership to sponsors/stakeholders to solve business process and/or technical problems by focusing on options that identify the pros and cons of those options and the risks and impacts of each option
  • Experience in building ITAM Programs and demonstrating value to an organization
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, customer-centric attitude, and situational awareness
  • Outstanding verbal, written, and presentation skills
  • Proven team player and team builder
  • Strong ownership, accountability, and attention to detail in all work efforts
  • Ability to travel 10% of the time

Education, Experience, and Certification Qualifications

  • Minimum 5 years experience in process definition, improvement, and re-engineering
  • Minimum 5 years experience developing requirements documentation, project artifacts, and process documents
  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent (minimum 6 years) work experience
  • Working knowledge of the ServiceNow platform
  • Prior experience with technical architects to translate business requirements into platform stories
  • ServiceNow ITAM-related Foundations training or CIS certification
  • ITIL v3 or v4 Certification
  • Business Process Management (BPC) training/certification

Perks? Oh, yes.

Cask's success is based on our most valuable asset - our people. We offer a robust benefits package designed with your needs in mind. We are passionate about investing in our people. As lifelong learners, we support your continued education and career development through paid training, including ServiceNow certifications. We build in training dollars and hours into our annual plan for each and every employee so you have the time and resources available to stretch yourself.

For more information about Cask’s benefits, please visit https://www.casknx.com/careers/.

We value diversity at our company. Cask is an equal opportunity employer. Everyone who applies with the qualifications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.

To learn more about Cask NX, please visit our website at https://www.casknx.com/ and be sure to follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook, and Twitter.

Check out our reviews on Glassdoor!

Cask NX LLC adheres to the Safer Federal Workforce Task Force COVID-19 Workplace Safety: Guidance for Federal Contractors and Subcontractors and Executive Order 14042, Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors, and conforms with the designated COVID-19 safeguards and workplace safety protocols; accordingly all job candidates must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to the first day of work and provide proof of such vaccination. The term “fully vaccinated” shall mean the candidate has received the single dose vaccine or the last dose of the double dose vaccine at least two weeks prior to commencing work for Cask NX LLC.

To all recruitment agencies: We do not accept unsolicited agency resumes and are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

results.title: Lead Business Consultant
results.description:
Start with Data is the leading product data management consultancy in the UK. We help our customers create long-lasting value from better product data management. Offering expert industry knowledge retailers, brands and manufacturers use Start with Data for Product Information Management (PIM) & Master Data Management (MDM) strategy, implementation and product content services.

Companies such as Pets at Home, Currys, Barbour, and RS Components trust Start with Data to ensure their product data meets the needs of their customers. Ask our customers and they will tell you the main thing that differentiates Start with Data is our people. PIM is our purpose, and our strong set of values underpin how our employees & associates deliver such a great experience for all our customers.

 

We are looking for bright, talented and driven people to come and join us on our journey.

 

You can read about some of our methodology and insights on our website.

 

About this role

Our Lead Business Consultants lead our largest projects with retail and brand clients, delivering value from better data management processes, data governance and PIM technology solutions.

 

 

As a Lead Business Consultant, you will ensure Start with Data delivers business change and solutions that meet our client objectives - as well as ensure that quality, complete and consistent product data is at the foundation of each client engagement.

 

 

Often working on large-scale retail and brand PIM transformation projects, you will lead a Start with Data delivery team that usually consists of you, a Lead Data Migration Consultant, a business analyst, a data architect, a solution architect & a number of solution configuration resources offshore.

 

 

In addition, you will act as a leading expert in PIM, and an excellent communicator to our clients. You will also have extensive experience in project management and client account management, acting as the first point of contact into our client delivery projects.

 

You will also confidently contribute to Start with Data's go-to-market strategy, pre-sales activities working with our CEO.

What we expect from you...

  • Plan and coordinate our PIM implementation project from discovery through to go-live

  • Own the governance and financial control of the project

  • Act as the advisor and PIM expert to our clients, helping them achieve their target outcomes

  • Coordinate workshops for process, data and solution requirements capture and design

  • Document functional specifications for PIM solutions including business processes and workflows, data models & non-functional requirements

  • Lead the design and configuration of PIM and MDM platforms, such as Enterworks, Salsify, Stibo and Sales Layer, working with our technical teams in UK and India

  • Support pre-sales activities with large client prospects

 
You must have:

  • Worked either in consulting or on the client side on several large-scale retail or brand product data-related projects, in the product data space

  • A leading understanding of retailer and brand operations models including product & supplier management, data onboarding, supply chain, enrichment, syndication, eCommerce & digital marketing

  • Played a leadership role in several major retailers or brand PIM or MDM projects, from discovery through to go-live

  • Extensive understanding of creating business cases for PIM & MDM, requirements capture, process design, data model design

  • Experience leading workshop activities, and coordinating business analysts and data architects to support these activities

  • Extensive understanding of product data lifecycle, and associated business challenges

  • Wide experience managing projects including planning, governance, financial, change management

  • A firm understanding of data governance concepts and how to apply accuracy, consistency and completeness principles in a PIM or MDM project

  • Experience with Visio, Lucid Charts, Confluence, Jira

 
You also may have...

  • Experience working with 1 or more MDM or PIM platforms such as Enterworks, Riversand, Informatica, Stibo, Salsify, Sales Layer or any other modern PIM or MDM solution

 
Our Culture & way of doing things

We have a vibrant, exciting and dynamic work environment on our projects. Our teams are multi-disciplined and relatively self-organising, so you will be used to operating in a flat, collaborative environment. We are highly entrepreneurial and value self-starters and solutions-oriented people.

 

 

Pay & Benefits

We look for exceptional Permanent and Fixed Term Consultants and our salaries, culture and benefits reflect that:

  • Competitive salary

  • 25 days annual leave plus bank holidays

  • Pension at a 5% matched contribution

  • Private medical cover

  • Career progression and training opportunities

  • Mac laptop and Apple phone when you start

  • Being part of the Start with Data community - In-person "Summer Party" and "Christmas party", online social events, daily trivia, online wellness events and virtual coffee

 

We also offer a chance to work as an Associate Consultant (our contracts are OIR35)

 

At this time we are not engaging with recruitment companies. If we ever need to explore other avenues, we have preferred suppliers on standby.
